CS:GO. Valve reported 5_000_000_000$ being made in 2016 from this so called game. Where did the money came from? Mostly from skin trades to underage kids. The whole new market of unregulated e-currencies was born and kids pockets were sucked dry. Don't belive those facts - just google them. Should we call Valve the soulless corporation now or it's the whole different story now day? Yeah. Sure. Today game is full of cheaters who also buy skins. Now - in order to avoid the risk of being banned, their accounts are instantly noticable by 200+ endorsements and thousands of play hours received on the "idle" maps. CSgo main page advertise cheaters and their play, you may check the HOUNGOUNGAGNE research on this in his "global elite.. with cheaters only" video. Valve got it's cut from this, and from skins gambling infrastructure around CS:GO. The controversery around that is a subject of FTC and other suits being a thing since 2015, but the valve prefer to pay off silently one way or another and nothing is expected to be done.
You, probably wonder, why the heck you've to read through all of this, instead of review of a gameplay mechanic and stuff. Well that is a perfect representation of a CSGO expirience nowdays: instead of enjoying the game you got rect from suspicious accounts and spent you time wondering why everything is so bad.
